page.title: 08Village Hall, Lound
page.content: Lound Village Hall is situated on Town Street facing East. Formerly a Chapel, its use changed to a Village Hall in l934. The Hall comes under the control of a Committee who look after maintenance, redecoration, heating and employ a caretaker. The Hall is used by many organisations and age groups. The Playschool, Youth Club,Women's Institute and the Jubilee Club (for the over-sixties) use the Hall regularly. The Young Ornithologists Club, the Agricultural Training Board and the Parish Council use it occasionally. The Hall is used also as a Polling Station. During the year there are many events. These include a Craft Show, jumble sales, book and toy sales, children's parties, fashion shows, dances, Christmas dinner for the over-sixties, concerts and rehearsals.
